meanings.definition: Tendency to allow behavior without strict control or restraint.
meanings.sent1: Her permissiveness towards her children's bedtime made them stay up late.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's permissiveness in the classroom led to chaos among the students.
meanings.sent3: The permissiveness of the traffic light made everyone cross the street at the same time.
meanings.sent4: The permissiveness of the rules allowed for creative thinking to flourish.
meanings.sent5: The permissiveness of the zoo enclosure resulted in the animals roaming freely.

meanings.definition: State of being lenient or tolerant in allowing behavior.
meanings.sent1: The permissiveness of the principal allowed the students to have a longer lunch break.
meanings.sent2: In a democracy, there is a level of permissiveness towards differing opinions.
meanings.sent3: The permissiveness of the weather forecast made everyone carry an umbrella just in case.
meanings.sent4: The permissiveness of the referee's calls made the game more enjoyable for the players.
meanings.sent5: The permissiveness of the library's policy on late returns made borrowing books stress-free.
